Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lid; interior glazed black with two narrow bands in added white at centre and two in added red near carinated edge of rim; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of two male figures in combat, Theseus and the Minotaur); of Theseus, top of head and right leg missing; red fillet on head, white band crossing chest, red decorated chiton, holding white-handled weapon in right hand; on right collapsing nude male figure, head and left leg missing; hands clasp round objects; traces of red above shoulder and red on torso; below, band in dilute above black zone with two added red lines; incrustations cover lower exterior surface of sherd;
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by The Petrie Museum of Egyptian Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
A scene of Theseus and the Minotaur, who is holding stones in his hands.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2130)
